alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Humphreys; Madison; Yazoo (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:16PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong winds will impact portions of southwestern Holmes, Yazoo, southeastern Humphreys and northern Madison Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 313 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated an outflow boundary along a line extending from 6 miles west of Thornton to near Coxburg to near Thomastown. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Camden around 330 PM CDT. Benton around 335 PM CDT. Yazoo City around 345 PM CDT. Farmhaven and Sharon around 350 PM CDT. Myrleville around 355 PM CDT. Little Yazoo around 400 PM CDT. Tinsley around 410 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. If on a lake in the path of this outflow boundary, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Boats could be damaged or overturned in high winds and suddenly higher waves. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central and west central Mississippi.
